greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of coefficients in expansion of (1+6x)^n.
comment: T(n,k) equals the number of n-length words on {0,1,...,6} having n-k zeros. - _Milan Janjic_, Jul 24 2015
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = 6^k*C(n,k) = Sum_{i=n-k..n} C(i,n-k)*C(n,i)*5^(n-i). Row sums are 7^n = A000420. - _Mircea Merca_, Apr 28 2012
T(n,k) = A007318(n,k)*A000400(k), 0 <= k <= n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 21 2013
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
